3    |  ** 									     **
4    |  **   Modules Revision 3.0						     **
5    |  **   Providing a flexible user environment				     **
6    |  ** 									     **
7    |  **   File:		main.c						     **
8    |  **   First Edition:	91/10/23					     **
9    |  ** 									     **
10   |  **   Authors:	John Furlan, jlf@behere.com				     **
11   |  **		Jens Hamisch, jens@Strawberry.COM			     **
12   |  ** 									     **
13   |  **   Description:	The main routine of Tcl Modules including all of     **
14   |  **			the global data.				     **
15   |  ** 									     **
16   |  **   Exports:		main		Main program			     **
17   |  **			module_usage	Module usage information	     **
18   |  **			Tcl_AppInit	Tcl Application initialization	     **
19   |  ** 									     **
20   |  **   Notes:								     **

32   | static char Id[] = "@(#)$Id: main.c.src.html,v 1.1 2005/11/15 03:43:35 rkowen Exp $";
33   | static void *UseId[] = { &UseId, Id };
34   | 
35   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
36   | /** 				      HEADERS				     **/
37   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
38   | 
39   | #include "modules_def.h"
40   | #include "getopt.h"
41   | 
42   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
43   | /** 				  LOCAL DATATYPES			     **/
44   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
45   | 
46   | /** not applicable **/
47   | 
48   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
49   | /** 				     CONSTANTS				     **/
50   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
51   | 
52   | /** not applicable **/
53   | 
54   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
55   | /**				      MACROS				     **/
56   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
57   | 
58   | /** not applicable **/
59   | 
60   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
61   | /** 				    GLOBAL DATA				     **/
62   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
63   | 
64   | char	 *g_current_module = NULL,	/** The module which is handled by   **/
65   | 					/** the current command		     **/
66   | 	 *g_specified_module = NULL,	/** The module that was specified    **/
67   | 					/** on the command line		     **/
68   | 	 *g_module_path = NULL,		/** The path to the module	     **/
69   | 	 *shell_name,			/** Name of the shell		     **/
70   | 					/** (first parameter to modulcmd)    **/
71   | 	 *shell_derelict,		/** Shell family (sh, csh, etc)	     **/
72   | 	 *shell_init,			/** Shell init script name	     **/
73   | 	 *shell_cmd_separator;		/** Shell command separator char     **/
74   | int	  g_flags = 0,			/** Control what to do at the moment **/
75   | 					/** The posible values are defined in**/
76   | 					/** module_def.h		     **/
77   | 	  append_flag = 0;		/** only used by the 'use' command   **/
78   | 
79   | char	  _default[] = "default";	/** id string for default versions   **/
80   | 
81   | /**
82   |  **  Name of the rc files
83   |  **  PREFIX points to the location where modules is going to be installed.
84   |  **  It comes from the Makefile
85   |  **/
86   | 
87   | char	*instpath = PREFIX,
88   | 	*rc_file = RCFILE,
89   | 	*modulerc_file = MODULERCFILE,
90   | 	*version_file = VERSIONFILE;
91   | 
92   | /**
93   |  **  pointers for regular expression evaluations
94   |  **/
95   | char
96   |     *addRE      = "^(add|load)", 		/** 'module add <file>'	     **/
97   |     *rmRE       = "^(rm|del|era|remov|unload)",	/** 'module unload <file>'   **/
98   |     *swRE       = "^sw",			/** 'module switch <file>'   **/
99   |     *dispRE     = "^(disp|show)", 		/** 'module display <file>'  **/
100  |     *listRE     = "^li", 			/** 'module list <file>'     **/
101  |     *availRE    = "^av",			/** 'module avail <file>'    **/
102  |     *helpRE     = "^(help|\\?)",		/** 'module help <file>'     **/
103  |     *initRE     = "^init",			/** 'module init'	     **/
104  |     *useRE      = "^use",			/** 'module use <file>'	     **/
105  |     *unuseRE    = "^unuse",			/** 'module unuse <file>'    **/
106  |     *updateRE   = "^update",			/** 'module update'	     **/
107  |     *purgeRE    = "^purge",			/** 'module purge'	     **/
108  |     *clearRE    = "^clear",			/** 'module clear'	     **/
109  |     *whatisRE   = "^wh",			/** 'module whatis'	     **/
110  |     *aproposRE  = "^(apr|key)";			/** 'module apropos'	     **/
111  | 
112  | /**
113  |  **  Hash-Tables for all changes to the environment.
114  |  **  ??? What do we save here, the old or the new setup ???
115  |  **/
116  | 
117  | Tcl_HashTable	*setenvHashTable,
118  | 		*unsetenvHashTable,
119  | 		*aliasSetHashTable,
120  | 		*aliasUnsetHashTable,
121  | 		*markVariableHashTable,
122  | 		*markAliasHashTable;
123  | 
124  | /**
125  |  **  A buffer for reading a single line
126  |  **/
127  | 
128  | char	*line = NULL;
129  | 
130  | /**
131  |  **  Flags influenced by the command line switches
132  |  **/
133  | 
134  | int	sw_force = 0,
135  | 	sw_detach = 0,
136  | 	sw_format = 0,
137  | 	sw_verbose = 0,
138  | 	sw_create = 0,
139  | 	sw_userlvl = UL_ADVANCED,
140  | 	sw_icase = 0;
141  | 
142  | /** ************************************************************************ **/
143  | /** 				    LOCAL DATA				     **/
144  | /** ************************************************************************ **/
145  | 
146  | static	char	module_name[] = "main.c";	/** File name of this module **/
147  | 
148  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING
149  | static	char	_proc_main[] = "main";
150  | #endif
151  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_INIT
152  | static	char	_proc_Check_Switches[] = "Check_Switches";
153  | static	char	_proc_Tcl_AppInit[] = "Tcl_AppInit";
154  | #endif
155  | 
156  | /** ************************************************************************ **/
157  | /**				    PROTOTYPES				     **/
158  | /** ************************************************************************ **/
159  | 
160  | static int	Check_Switches( int *argc, char *argv[]);
161  | static void	version (FILE *output);
162  | 
163  | /*++++
164  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
165  |  ** 									     **
166  |  **   Function:		main						     **
167  |  ** 									     **
168  |  **   Description:	Main program					     **
169  |  ** 									     **
170  |  **   First Edition:	91/10/23					     **
171  |  ** 									     **
172  |  **   Parameters:	int	argc		Number of parameters	     **
173  |  **			char	*argv[]		Command line arguments	     **
174  |  **			char	*environ[]	Pointer to the process' en-  **
175  |  **						vironment.		     **
176  |  **   Result:		int	1		Usage information printed    **
177  |  **				TCL_OK		Successful completion	     **
178  |  **				other		Return value of the module   **
179  |  **			 			subcomand		     **
180  |  ** 									     **
181  |  **   Attached Globals:	*Ptr	 	by InitializeTcl		     **
182  |  **			*HashTable	by InitializeTcl	 	     **
183  |  ** 									     **
184  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
185  |  ++++*/
186  | 
187  | int	main( int argc, char *argv[], char *environ[]) {
188  | 
189  |     Tcl_Interp	*interp;
190  |     int          return_val = 0;
191  |     char	*rc_name;
192  |     char	*rc_path;
193  | 
194  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING
195  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_START, LOC, _proc_main, NULL);
196  | #endif
197  |     /**
198  |      ** check if first argument is --version or -V then output the
199  |      ** version to stdout.  This is a special circumstance handled
200  |      ** by the regular options.
201  |      **/
202  |     if (argc > 1 && *argv[1] == '-') {
203  |         if (!strcmp("-V", argv[1]) || !strcmp("--version", argv[1])) {
204  | 	    version(stdout);
205  | 	    return 0;
206  |         }
207  |     }
208  |     /**
209  |      **  Initialization. 
210  |      **  Check the command line syntax. There will be no return from the
211  |      **  initialization function in case of invalid command line arguments.
212  |      **/
213  | 
214  |     if( TCL_OK != Initialize_Tcl( &interp, argc, argv, environ))
215  | 	goto unwind0;
216  | 
217  |     if( TCL_OK != Setup_Environment( interp))
218  | 	goto unwind0;
219  | 
220  |     /**
221  |      **  Check for command line switches
222  |      **/
223  | 
224  |     if( TCL_OK != Check_Switches( &argc, argv))
225  | 	goto unwind0;
226  | 
227  |     /**
228  |      **  Figure out, which global RC file to use. This depends on the environ-
229  |      **  ment variable 'MODULERCFILE', which can be set to one of the following:
230  |      **
231  |      **		<filename>	-->	PREFIX/etc/<filename>
232  |      **		<dir>/		-->	<dir>/RC_FILE
233  |      **		<dir>/<file>	-->	<dir>/<file>
234  |      **  Use xgetenv to expand 1 level of env.vars.
235  |      **/
236  | 
237  |     if((rc_name = xgetenv( "MODULERCFILE"))) {
238  | 	/* found something in MODULERCFILE */
239  | 	if((char *) NULL == (rc_path = stringer(NULL,0,rc_name,NULL))) {
240  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
241  | 		goto unwind1;
242  | 	    else
243  | 		null_free((void *) &rc_name);
244  | 	} else {
245  | 	    null_free((void *) &rc_name);
246  | 	    if((char *) NULL == (rc_name = strrchr( rc_path, '/'))) {
247  | 		rc_name = rc_path;
248  | 		rc_path = instpath;
249  | 	    } else
250  | 		*rc_name++ = '\0';
251  | 	    if( !*rc_name) {
252  | 		rc_name = rc_file;
253  | 	    }
254  | 	}
255  |     } else {
256  | 	rc_path = instpath;
257  | 	null_free((void *) &rc_name);
258  | 	rc_name = rc_file;
259  |     }
260  | 
261  |     /**
262  |      **  Finally we have to change PREFIX -> PREFIX/etc
263  |      **/
264  | 
265  |     if( rc_path == instpath) {
266  | 	if((char *) NULL == (rc_path = stringer(NULL,0, instpath,"/etc",NULL))){
267  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL))
268  | 		goto unwind1;
269  | 	    else
270  | 		rc_path = NULL;
271  | 	
272  | 	}
273  |     }
274  | 
275  |     /**
276  |      **  Source the global and the user defined RC file
277  |      **/
278  | 
279  |     g_current_module = (char *) NULL;
280  | 
281  |     if( TCL_ERROR == SourceRC( interp, rc_path, rc_name) ||
282  | 	TCL_ERROR == SourceRC( interp, getenv( "HOME"), modulerc_file))
283  | 	exit( 1);
284  | 
285  |     if( rc_path)
286  | 	null_free((void *) &rc_path);
287  | 
288  |     /**
289  |      **  Invocation of the module command as specified in the command line
290  |      **/
291  | 
292  |     g_flags = 0;
293  |     return_val = cmdModule((ClientData) 0, interp, (argc - 1), (argv + 1));
294  | 
295  |     /**
296  |      **  If we were doing some operation that has already flushed its output,
297  |      **  then we don't need to re-flush the output here.
298  |      **
299  |      **  Also, if we've had an error here, then the whole modulecmd failed
300  |      **  and not just the values for a single modulefile.  So, we'll pass in
301  |      **  a NULL here to indicate that any error message should say that
302  |      **  absolutely NO changes were made to the environment.
303  |      **/
304  | 
305  |     if( TCL_OK == return_val) {
306  | 	Output_Modulefile_Changes( interp);
307  | #ifdef HAS_X11LIBS
308  | 	xresourceFinish( 1);
309  | #endif
310  |     } else {
311  | 	Unwind_Modulefile_Changes( interp, NULL);
312  | #ifdef HAS_X11LIBS
313  | 	xresourceFinish( 0);
314  | #endif
315  |     }
316  | 
317  |     /**
318  |      **  Finally clean up. Delete the required hash tables and conditionally
319  |      **  allocated areas.
320  |      **/
321  | 
322  |     Delete_Global_Hash_Tables();
323  | 
324  |     if( line)
325  | 	null_free((void *) &line);
326  |     if( error_line)
327  | 	null_free((void *) &error_line);
328  | 
329  |     /**
330  |      **  This return value may be evaluated by the calling shell
331  |      **/
332  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING
333  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_END, LOC, _proc_main, NULL);
334  | #endif
335  | 
336  |     return ( return_val);
337  | 
338  | unwind2:
339  |     null_free((void *) &rc_path);
340  | unwind1:
341  |     null_free((void *) &rc_name);
342  | unwind0:
343  | 
344  |     /* and error occurred of some type */
345  |     return( 1);
346  | 
347  | } /** End of 'main' **/
348  | 
349  | /*++++
350  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
351  |  ** 									     **
352  |  **   Function:		module_usage					     **
353  |  ** 									     **
354  |  **   Description:	Lists out the helpful usage info that we've all come **
355  |  ** 			to expect from unix commands.			     **
356  |  ** 									     **
357  |  **   First Edition:	2002/10/13					     **
358  |  ** 									     **
359  |  **   Parameters:	FILE	*output		Where the output goes	     **
360  |  ** 									     **
361  |  **   Result:		void			No return values	     **
362  |  ** 									     **
363  |  **   Attached Globals:							     **
364  |  ** 			version_string		Current module version	     **
365  |  ** 									     **
366  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
367  |  ++++*/
368  | 
369  | void module_usage(FILE *output)
370  | {
371  |     /**
372  |      **  General help wanted.
373  |      **/
374  | 
375  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_MODULECMD
376  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_START, LOC, _proc_ModuleCmd_Help, NULL);
377  | #endif
378  | 
379  | 	fprintf(output,
380  | 		"\n  Modules Release %s (Copyright GNU GPL v2 1991):\n\n",
381  |                 version_string);
382  | 	
383  | 	fprintf(output,
384  | "  Usage: module [ switches ] [ subcommand ] [subcommand-args ]\n\n"
385  | "Switches:\n"
386  | "	-H|--help		this usage info\n"
387  | "	-V|--version		modules version & configuration options\n"
388  | "	-f|--force		force active dependency resolution\n"
389  | "	-t|--terse		terse    format avail and list format\n"
390  | "	-l|--long		long     format avail and list format\n"
391  | "	-h|--human		readable format avail and list format\n"
392  | "	-v|--verbose		enable  verbose messages\n"
393  | "	-s|--silent		disable verbose messages\n"
394  | "	-c|--create		create caches for avail and apropos\n"
395  | "	-i|--icase		case insensitive\n"
396  | "	-u|--userlvl <lvl>	set user level to (nov[ice],exp[ert],adv[anced])\n"
397  | "  Available SubCommands and Args:\n"
398  | "	+ add|load		modulefile [modulefile ...]\n"
399  | "	+ rm|unload		modulefile [modulefile ...]\n"
400  | "	+ switch|swap		[modulefile1] modulefile2\n"
401  | "	+ display|show		modulefile [modulefile ...]\n"
402  | "	+ avail			[modulefile [modulefile ...]]\n"
403  | "	+ use [-a|--append]	dir [dir ...]\n"
404  | "	+ unuse			dir [dir ...]\n"
405  | #ifdef BEGINENV
406  | "	+ update\n"
407  | #endif
408  | "	+ purge\n"
409  | "	+ list\n"
410  | "	+ clear\n"
411  | "	+ help			[modulefile [modulefile ...]]\n"
412  | "	+ whatis		[modulefile [modulefile ...]]\n"
413  | "	+ apropos|keyword	string\n"
414  | "	+ initadd		modulefile [modulefile ...]\n"
415  | "	+ initprepend		modulefile [modulefile ...]\n"
416  | "	+ initrm		modulefile [modulefile ...]\n"
417  | "	+ initswitch		modulefile1 modulefile2\n"
418  | "	+ initlist\n"
419  | "	+ initclear\n\n");
420  | 
421  | } /** End of 'module_usage' **/
422  | 
423  | /*++++
424  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
425  |  ** 									     **
426  |  **   Function:		Tcl_AppInit					     **
427  |  ** 									     **
428  |  **   Description:	This is needed if you use shared TCL libraries.	     **
429  |  **			It won't be called, but the linker complains if it   **
430  |  **		   	doesn't exist.					     **
431  |  ** 									     **
432  |  **   First Edition:	91/10/23					     **
433  |  ** 									     **
434  |  **   Parameters:	Tcl_Interp	*interp		Tcl interpreter to   **
435  |  **							be initialized	     **
436  |  **   Result:		int		TCL_OK		Initialization succ. **
437  |  **   Attached Globals:	-						     **
438  |  ** 									     **
439  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
440  |  ++++*/
441  | 
442  | int Tcl_AppInit(Tcl_Interp *interp)
443  | {
444  | 
445  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_INIT
446  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_START, LOC, _proc_Tcl_AppInit, NULL);
447  | #endif
448  | 
449  |     return( TCL_OK);
450  | 
451  | } /** End of 'Tcl_AppInit' **/
452  | 
453  | /*++++
454  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
455  |  ** 									     **
456  |  **   Function:		Check_Switches					     **
457  |  ** 									     **
458  |  **   Description:	Check for command line switches and set internal     **
459  |  **			control variable according to them. Command line     **
460  |  **			switches are defined to appear between the shell and **
461  |  **			the module command. They begin on a dash and may     **
462  |  **			appear in long and short format. 		     **
463  |  **									     **
464  |  **			The following switches are defined:		     **
465  |  **									     **
466  |  **			    --force, -f		Force prerequired actions    **
467  |  **			    --terse, -t		Terse, parseable messages    **
468  |  **			    --human, -h		Human readable form          **
469  |  **			    --long, -l		Long messages		     **
470  |  **			    --verbose, -v	Verbose mode on		     **
471  |  **			    --silent, -s	Verbose mode off	     **
472  |  **			    --create, -c	Create a cache while execu-  **
473  |  **						ting the command	     **
474  |  **			    --userlvl, -u	Change the user level	     **
475  |  **			    --icase, -i		Ignore case of modulefile    **
476  |  **						names			     **
477  |  **			    --help, -H		Helpful usage info	     **
478  |  **			    --version, -V	Report version only	     **
479  |  ** 									     **
480  |  **   First Edition:	1995/12/20					     **
481  |  ** 									     **
482  |  **   Parameters:	int	*argc		Number of parameters	     **
483  |  **			char	*argv[]		Command line arguments	     **
484  |  **									     **
485  |  **   Result:		int	TCL_OK		Successful completion	     **
486  |  **				TCL_ERROR	Unknown switch found	     **
487  |  **			*argc, *argv		All switches are removed     **
488  |  **						from the argv vector	     **
489  |  ** 									     **
490  |  **   Attached Globals:	sw_force		--force, -f		     **
491  |  **			sw_format		-t, -l, -h, -p               **
492  |  **			sw_verbose		--verbose, -v, --silent, -s  **
493  |  **			sw_create		--create, -c		     **
494  |  **			sw_userlvl		--userlvl, -u		     **
495  |  **			sw_icase		--icase, -i		     **
496  |  ** 									     **
497  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
498  |  ++++*/
499  | 
500  | static int	Check_Switches( int *argc, char *argv[])
501  | {
502  | 
503  |     int c;
504  | 
505  |     /**
506  |      **  These are the options we do provide
507  |      **/
508  | 
509  |     const struct option longopts[] = {
510  | 	{ "force", no_argument, NULL, 'f' },
511  | 	{ "terse", no_argument, NULL, 't' },
512  | 	{ "long", no_argument, NULL, 'l' },
513  | 	{ "human", no_argument, NULL, 'h' },
514  | 	{ "parseable", no_argument, NULL, 'p' },
515  | 	{ "parse", no_argument, NULL, 'p' },
516  | 	{ "verbose", no_argument, NULL, 'v' },
517  | 	{ "silent", no_argument, NULL, 's' },
518  | 	{ "create", no_argument, NULL, 'c' },
519  | 	{ "icase", no_argument, NULL, 'i' },
520  | 	{ "userlvl", required_argument, NULL, 'u'},
521  | 	{ "append", no_argument, NULL, 'a' },
522  | 	{ "help", no_argument, NULL, 'H' },
523  | 	{ "version", no_argument, NULL, 'V' },
524  | 	{ NULL, no_argument, NULL, 0 }
525  |     };
526  | 
527  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_INIT
528  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_START, LOC, _proc_Check_Switches, NULL);
529  | #endif
530  | 
531  |     /**
532  |      **  Scan the command line for options defined in the longopt table.
533  |      **  Skip the very first argument, which is the shell to be used
534  |      **/
535  | 
536  |     if( *argc > 1) {
537  | 
538  | 	while( EOF != (c = getopt_long( *argc-1, &argv[1], "hpftlvsciu:aHV",
539  | 	    longopts, NULL))) {
540  | 
541  | 	    switch( c) {
542  | 
543  | 		/**
544  | 		 **  Force
545  | 		 **/
546  | 
547  | 		case 'f':			/* force */
548  | 		    sw_force = 1;
549  | 		    break;
550  | 
551  | 		/**
552  | 		 **  Format of the messages
553  | 		 **/
554  | 
555  | 		case 't':			/* terse */
556  | 		    sw_format |= (SW_SET | SW_TERSE);
557  | 		    sw_format &= ~ SW_LONG;
558  | 		    break;
559  | 
560  | 		case 'l':			/* long */
561  | 		    sw_format |= (SW_SET | SW_LONG);
562  | 		    sw_format &= ~ SW_TERSE;
563  | 		    break;
564  | 
565  | 		case 'h':			/* human */
566  | 		    sw_format |= (SW_SET | SW_HUMAN);
567  | 		    sw_format &= ~ SW_PARSE;
568  | 		    break;
569  | 
570  | 		case 'p':			/* parseable */
571  | 		    sw_format |= (SW_SET | SW_PARSE);
572  | 		    sw_format &= ~ SW_HUMAN;
573  | 		    break;
574  | 
575  | 		/**
576  | 		 **  Verbosity
577  | 		 **/
578  | 
579  | 		case 'v':			/* verbose */
580  | 		    sw_verbose = 1;
581  | 		    break;
582  | 
583  | 		case 's':			/* silent */
584  | 		    sw_detach = 1;
585  | 		    break;
586  | 
587  | 		/**
588  | 		 **  Caching control
589  | 		 **/
590  | 
591  | 		case 'c':			/* create */
592  | 		    sw_create = 1;
593  | 		    break;
594  | 
595  | 		/**
596  | 		 **  Locating
597  | 		 **/
598  | 
599  | 		case 'i':			/* icase */
600  | 		    sw_icase = 1;
601  | 		    break;
602  | 
603  | 		/**
604  | 		 **  The user level comes as a string argument to the -u option
605  | 		 **/
606  | 
607  | 		case 'u':			/* userlvl */
608  | 		    cmdModuleUser_sub( optarg);
609  | 		    break;
610  | 
611  | 		/**
612  | 		 **  a special purpose flag for 'use' only
613  | 		 **/
614  | 		case 'a':			/* --append */
615  | 		    append_flag = 1;
616  | 		    break;
617  | 
618  | 		case 'H':			/* helpful info */
619  | 		    module_usage(stderr);
620  | 		    return ~TCL_OK;
621  | 
622  | 		case 'V':			/* version */
623  | 		    version(stderr);
624  | 		    return ~TCL_OK;
625  | 
626  | 		/**
627  | 		 **  All remaining options will influence their flags as defined
628  | 		 **  in the optlong table above.
629  | 		 **/
630  | 
631  | 		case 0:
632  | 		    break;
633  | 
634  | 		/**
635  | 		 **  Error messages for unknown options will be printed by
636  | 		 **  getopt ...
637  | 		 **/
638  | 
639  | 		case '?':
640  | 		    break;
641  | 
642  | 		/**
643  | 		 **  Well, this seems to be an internal error
644  | 		 **/
645  | 
646  | 		default:
647  | 		    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_GETOPT, LOC, NULL))
648  | 			return( TCL_ERROR);	/** --- EXIT (FAILURE) ----> **/
649  | 		    break;
650  | 
651  | 	    }  /** switch() **/
652  | 	}  /** while() **/
653  |     } /** if( argc) **/
654  | 
655  |     /**
656  |      **  Special things to be dine for the 'silent' option: Pipe stderr
657  |      **  output to /dev/null
658  |      **/
659  | 
660  |     if( sw_detach) {
661  | 	sw_verbose = 0;
662  | 	if (!ttyname(2)) {
663  | 	    int temp_fd = open("/dev/null", O_RDWR);
664  | 
665  | 	    close(2);
666  | 	    dup2(temp_fd, 2);
667  | 	}
668  |     }
669  | 
670  |     /**
671  |      **  Finally remove all options from the command line stream
672  |      **/
673  | 
674  |     c = optind - 1;
675  |     if( optind < *argc && c > 0) {
676  | 	while( optind < *argc) {
677  | 	    argv[ optind-c] = argv[ optind];
678  | 	    optind++;
679  | 	}
680  | 	*argc -= c;
681  |     }
682  | 
683  |     /**
684  |      **  Exit on success
685  |      **/
686  | 
687  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_INIT
688  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_END, LOC, _proc_Check_Switches, NULL);
689  | #endif
690  | 
691  |     return( TCL_OK);
692  | 
693  | } /** End of 'Check_Switches' **/
694  | 
695  | /*++++
696  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
697  |  ** 									     **
698  |  **   Function:		dup2						     **
699  |  ** 									     **
700  |  **   Description:	Duplicate file descriptor			     **
701  |  ** 									     **
702  |  **   First Edition:	96/02/08					     **
703  |  ** 									     **
704  |  **   Parameters:	int	old		Old file descriptor	     **
705  |  **			int	new		New file descriptor	     **
706  |  **									     **
707  |  **   Result:		int	-1		any error		     **
708  |  **				other		new file descriptor	     **
709  |  ** 									     **
710  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
711  |  ++++*/
712  | 
713  | #ifndef HAVE_DUP2
714  | int dup2( int old, int new)
715  | {
716  |     int fd;
717  | 
718  |     close(new);
719  |     fd = dup(old);
720  |     if (fd != new) {
721  | 	close( fd);
722  | 	errno = EMFILE;
723  | 	fd = -1;
724  |     }
725  | 
726  |     return( fd);
727  | }
728  | #endif
729  | 
730  | /*++++
731  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
732  |  ** 									     **
733  |  **   Function:		version						     **
734  |  ** 									     **
735  |  **   Description:	Outputs the Modules version and features	     **
736  |  ** 									     **
737  |  **   First Edition:	2002/06/13					     **
738  |  ** 									     **
739  |  **   Parameters:	FILE *	output		All input is from defined    **
740  |  **						macros			     **
741  |  **									     **
742  |  **   Result:		void			no return value		     **
743  |  **						All output is to output	     **
744  |  ** 									     **
745  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
746  |  ++++*/
747  | 
748  | #define str(a) #a
749  | #define isdefined(a,b)	{if (strcmp(str(a),b)) x=str(a); else x="undef"; \
750  | 			fprintf(output,format,b,x);}
751  | 
752  | static void version (FILE *output) {
753  | 	char	*x,
754  | 		*format = "%s=%s\n";
755  | 
756  | 	fprintf(output, format, "VERSION", version_string);
757  | 	fprintf(output, "\n");
758  | 	isdefined(AUTOLOADPATH,str(AUTOLOADPATH));
759  | 	isdefined(BEGINENV,str(BEGINENV));
760  | 	isdefined(CACHE_AVAIL,str(CACHE_AVAIL));
761  | 	isdefined(DEF_COLLATE_BY_NUMBER,str(DEF_COLLATE_BY_NUMBER));
762  | 	isdefined(DOT_EXT,str(DOT_EXT));
763  | 	isdefined(HAS_BOURNE_FUNCS,str(HAS_BOURNE_FUNCS));
764  | 	isdefined(HAS_BOURNE_ALIAS,str(HAS_BOURNE_ALIAS));
765  | 	isdefined(EVAL_ALIAS,str(EVAL_ALIAS));
766  | 	isdefined(LMSPLIT_SIZE,str(LMSPLIT_SIZE));
767  | 	isdefined(MODULEPATH,str(MODULEPATH));
768  | 	isdefined(MODULES_INIT_DIR,str(MODULES_INIT_DIR));
769  | 	isdefined(PREFIX,str(PREFIX));
770  | 	isdefined(TMP_DIR,str(TMP_DIR));
771  | 	isdefined(USE_FREE,str(USE_FREE));
772  | 	isdefined(VERSION_MAGIC,str(VERSION_MAGIC));
773  | 	isdefined(VERSIONPATH,str(VERSIONPATH));
774  | 	isdefined(WANTS_VERSIONING,str(WANTS_VERSIONING));
775  | 	isdefined(WITH_DEBUG_INFO,str(WITH_DEBUG_INFO));
776  | }
777  | 
778  | #undef str
779  | #undef isdefined
